ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:0.5_0: 75. The training rule on defecating in water
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics defecate, urinate, and spit in water? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.5_0: The monks heard those people complaining,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.7_0: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.11_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.13_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.14.1_0: ‘“I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:1.15_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.1_0: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, sick monks did not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.3_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.4_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.5_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.6.1_0: ‘“When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.7_0: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.8_0: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits in water, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.14_0: if she does it on dry ground, but it then spreads to water;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.15_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.18_0: if he is overwhelmed by pain;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.20_0: The group of fifteen on the fifteenth day, is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.21_0: The seventh sub-chapter on shoes is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.22_0: “Venerables, the rules to be trained in have been recited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.23_0: In regard to this I will ask you:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.25_0: A second time I ask the Sangha to answer:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.29_0: You will remember it, please remember it; I will remember it thus.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.30_0: The rules to be trained in are finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk75:2.31_0: The section on the legal procedure is finished.
